title: Remembering Derek Martin: EastEnders Star's Life and Legacy at 92
summary: Derek Martin, renowned for his portrayal of Charlie Slater on the BBC soap opera EastEnders, passed away at the age of 92. Born in Bow, East London, Martin began his acting career in the 1960s after working in factories and as a butcher at Smithfield Market. He joined EastEnders in 2000 as a widower with four daughters, becoming a regular cast member until 2011 and making guest appearances until his character's death in 2016. Throughout his career, Martin appeared in various TV programmes such as Doctor Who, Z-Cars, The Sweeney, and Law & Order, despite having no formal acting training. His family and agent described him as a devoted father, a generous member of the charitable Water Rats, and an avid golfer, emphasizing his authentic working-class voice in British television. EastEnders expressed deep sadness, noting that his character Charlie Slater was iconic and that Martin was beloved by colleagues. The article serves as an obituary, celebrating his contributions to entertainment and personal qualities.

Martin's background as a working-class Londoner added authenticity to his roles, and he became a beloved figure in British television. His death marks the loss of a veteran actor who contributed to many classic TV shows, highlighting the impact of long-running soap operas on popular culture and the personal tributes from industry peers.
